Monna ( [ 6 ],  p.  125 ) proved the following form of the Uniform Boundedness Theorem. 
Theorem 4.  Let E and G be non - Archimedean normed spaces oi^er K,  If E is complete,  then a set H ^L ( E,  G ) is bounded in norm if and only if for any x^E,  the set H ( x ) = { / ( д ; ) I / ê H } is bounded in G. 
A dual form of this theorem can be proved for spherically complete spaces. 
Corollary 5.  Let E and G be non - Archimedean normed spaces over K.  If G is cally complete^ then a set A ^ E is bounded if and only if for each f^L { E,  G ),  f ( A ) is bounded in G. 
Proof,  Since / is an isometry,  A is bounded if and only if J { A ) is bounded.  Since L ( E^ G ) is complete ( since G is spherically complete and hence complete ).  Theorem 4 implies that J { A ) is bounded if and only if for each f^L ( E,  G ),  J ( A ) ( f ) = f ( A ) is bounded in G, 
Monna [ 4 ] defined a property analogous to convexity.  A subset 5 of a vector space E over К is said to have property ( C ) if for any x^y ^ S and any Я,  / / € Z such that I A I ^ 1 and | ^ | ^ 1 it follows that Xx + juy ^ S,  A set is said to be K - conçex if it is a translate of a set having property ( C ).  A set is a K - convex body if it is a translate of an absorbing iiT - convex set.  A topological vector space is locally K - convex if it has a fundamental system of neighborhoods of 0 consisting of ÜT - convex sets.  A non - Archimedean seminorm on £ " is a seminorm p satisfying p { x + y ) ^ max { р { х ),  p ( y ) }.  If /?  is a semi - norm on E,  then E is p - spherically complete if every descending sequence of spheres { x\ p { x — xj ^ rj has a non - empty intersection.  The following two results extend a theorem due to Monna ( [ 5 ],  p.  400 ). 
Theorem 6.  Let E be a locally K - convex space over К and let G be equipped with the topology defined by a single seminorm q for which G is q - spherically complete.  Then every continuous linear function / q from a subspace V of E into G has a continuous linear sion to E. 
Proof,  Since E is locally üT - convex and / o is continuous,  there is a Ä' - convex borhood iS of 0 in E such that q { fo ( x ) ) < 1 for any x^S.  Since S ш a üC - convex body,  there is a non - Archimedean seminorm p onE such that { x\ p { x ) < 1 } ш S ^ { x \ p { x ) ^ 1 } ( [ 4 ],  p.  535 ).  Clearly,  p is continuous since 5 " is a neighborhood.
